intro: Notodanthonia pulchra, commonly known as the pink needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, pinkish to purple spikelets that are clustered at the ends of its flowering stems. Notodanthonia pulchra thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and woodland areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native gardens and conservation projects.
